name: "A Poet That Knows It"

text:
Target creature blocks this turn if able. You may have that creature gain reach until end of turn.

name: "Approach of the Dragon"
text:
"Approach of the Dragon" deals 3 damage to each opponent. Then you may exile "Approach of the Dragon" and four other cards named "Approach of the Dragon" from your graveyard. If you do, search your library for a Dragon creature card, put it into the battlefield, then shuffle.
A deck can have any number of cards named "Approach of the Dragon".

text:

text: Magecraft — Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, until end of turn, target creature you control gains "When this creature leaves the battlefield, exile it instead" and "When this creature is exiled, create a 4/4 blue and red Elemental creature token."

flavor: Ancient ruins dot the world of Arcavios, most older than Strixhaven itself and many still guarded by soldiers from the Blood Age, centuries after their deaths.
name: Ageless Guardian
Archmage Emeritus
text: Magecraft — Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, draw a card.

flavor: Some emeritus professors return from their wanderings periodically to share tales of the mystical wonders of Arcavios.

text: Magecraft — Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, draw a card.

text: Magecraft — Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, draw a card.

flavor:
"I've lived too long in my father's shadow. It's time to find my own light."
—Killian, Silverquill mage-student
name: Beaming Defiance
text: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

flavor: "So you see, the reckless battle strategy of the Kathorran orcs was effective, but ultimately proved to be a double-edged sword. As did their double-edged swords.
name: Blade Historian
text: Attacking creatures you control have double strike.

name: Blade Historian
text: Attacking creatures you control have double strike.

flavor: There are no weapons allowed in the Biblioplex, but a clever mage is never truly defenseless.
name: Bury in Books
text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if it targets an attacking creature.
Put target creature into its owner's library second from the top.

flavor: "There is nowhere in Strixhaven I can't find. Where do you need to go?"
name: Campus Guide
text: When Campus Guide enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on top.

flavor: "You're too dim to realize it, but you've already lost."
name: Clever Lumimancer
text: Magecraft — Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, Clever Lumimancer gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

name: Codie, Vociferous Codex
text:
You can't cast permanent spells.
{4}, {T}: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}. When you cast your next spell this turn, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile an instant or sorcery card with lesser mana value. Until end of turn, you may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Put each other card exiled this way on the bottom of your library in a random order.

flavor: "Before Yovus was cut down at Pranticle Peak, she performed which maneuver? Anyone? From the reading?"

Flying

flavor: Will's quick thinking meshed with Rowan's raw power to bring down the Blood Avatar.

text: Exile the top X cards of your library. For each land card exiled this way, create a Treasure token. For each blue card exiled this way, draw a card. For each red card exiled this way, Culmination of Studies deals 1 damage to each opponent.

flavor: "*Kathorran War Chants, Vol. III*? That doesn't even belong in this wing!"

text:
Look at the top two cards of your library. Put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest back on top of your library in any order.
